Job Title: Senior Operations Manager

Location: Greater Chicago Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Are you a dynamic leader with a passion for operational excellence? We are seeking a Senior Operations Manager to spearhead our daily operations across three shifts. This role is pivotal in achieving our departmental goals in Safety, Quality, Customer Service, Cost Management, and People Development & Engagement. 
As the Senior Operations Manager, you will: 
Lead a Diverse Team: Oversee a broad team of Production Supervisors and Hourly Employees, fostering a positive work culture and promoting employee engagement. Drive Operational Efficiency: Manage day-to-day production activities to ensure smooth operations. You will coordinate and optimize the production schedule for each shift and department to meet our ambitious production goals. Champion Quality Control: Ensure compliance with the plant’s quality control programs to meet all food safety/quality objectives. Your focus will be on process reliability, product quality, and reducing consumer complaints. Promote Continuous Improvement: Review efficiencies, improve processes, and recommend equipment, materials, and tools. You will drive continuous improvement with a focus on safety, food safety, and Lean manufacturing criteria. Develop Talent: Evaluate staffing requirements and provide guidance, support, and coaching to all Supervisors and Hourly Associates. You will monitor the training and development of Production Supervisors to ensure their effectiveness and skill growth. Ensure Safety: Drive a safety culture throughout the plant, ensuring consistent regulatory compliance. You will lead investigations into safety concerns and ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local environmental and safety regulations. Maintain Compliance: Ensure and maintain compliance with safety, quality, and professional standards within our food manufacturing facility. Coordinate Maintenance: Be responsible for coordinating the maintenance of equipment through the Maintenance Team, managing physical assets for safety and usefulness. 
This role reports directly to the Plant Director and offers an excellent opportunity to make a significant impact on our operations. If you are ready to take up this challenging and rewarding role, we would love to hear from you!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
